Hi guys. We are a travel startup looking for 2 full time devs at the junior level. Commitment = 7 hours every week day.

Our main need right now is reliable dev power, not necessarily senior experience. As long as you have a good base and are willing to grow more with us, then you should apply.

The stack: (I can guide you through the ones you are not familiar with)
React + Redux
Hapi.js (Node.js)
MongoDB
Jest
ElasticSearch
Docker

I am using react-bootstrap (latest version) and I have a form which uses the <Form> and <FormControl> components.  I cannot for the life of me figure out how to do form validation on fields with it such as making fields required, etc. and I'm finding the examples fairly useless.  

I've tried setting the <FormControl required='true'> and various other things, but just doesn't seem to make it required.  What am I missing?

<Col componentClass={ControlLabel} sm={2}>
    Curr. Term Renewal Date
</Col>
<Col sm={3} md={2}>
  <FormControl id="renewalDueDate" type=“date"
  sm={2} ref=‘renewalDueDate'
  placeholder="Orig. Term. Date”
  onChange={this.handleChange} />
</Col>

data.message:
up till today, in my company we had two major applications which each had a server serving their static content as well as backend api (one node server doing both, using express, for each application).
we feel its time to make a common api server for these and future applications as well,
so my questions are :
1. is it good practice for each app to have some node server which will make http requests to that api server and have some business logic layer to digest the data spicifically for the application's needs? and not make requests the api server straight from the client (which i'm guessing will have CORS trouble as well as security issues)
2. if i have say a complex query for data involving multiple entities and digesting, and this query is relevant to more than one app, should it be part of the api server? or should i always keep the api server very flat, only reaching for data per entity etc?
thanks

Hey,
I'm working in a personal project which name is Paid.

const storeRoot = createStore(RootReducer, applyMiddleware(thunk));
const storePage = createStore(PageReducer, applyMiddleware(thunk));
/* Render */
ReactDOM.render(
<Provider store={storeRoot}>
<RootComponent />
</Provider>
, document.getElementById("idroot"));
ReactDOM.render(
<Provider store={storePage}>
<PageComponent />
</Provider>
, document.getElementById("idpage"));
-------------------------------------------------
how to using storeRoot at component <PageComponent /> ?
i want to create multiple store (global store and temporary store at the page)
any idea or reference?
